meanings.definition: Resembling or related to a sea urchin.
meanings.sent1: The echinoid creature had spiky skin like a sea urchin.
meanings.sent2: The artist painted a beautiful echinoid seashell.
meanings.sent3: The echinoid starfish wore a tiny crown of spikes.
meanings.sent4: Her personality was as prickly as an echinoid hedgehog.
meanings.sent5: The echinoid pattern on the fabric was eye-catching.

meanings.definition: A marine invertebrate with a round, spiny shell.
meanings.sent1: We observed an echinoid moving slowly on the ocean floor.
meanings.sent2: The echinoid's shell provided protection from predators.
meanings.sent3: The echinoid invited all the sea creatures to its shell party.
meanings.sent4: The echinoid's spines glinted in the sunlight like jewels.
meanings.sent5: Children collected colorful echinoids along the shore.
